title: Should I be OTP?
body: I lose much of games these times and it is mainly because I play different champions and roles for 2-3 games. Should I play only one champion,will I after 20ish games finally go on winnimg streak?

replies.body:
one tricking a champ only helps you get better at macro play so it won't suddenly make you challenger

It's kind of handicapping yourself at the end of the day, so I'd recommend getting good at a handful of champs instead of just one.

>
> one tricking a champ only helps you get better at macro play so it won't suddenly make you challenger
> 
> It's kind of handicapping yourself at the end of the day, so I'd recommend getting good at a handful of champs instead of just one.

Good macro play is most of all it takes to hit gold 

I advise learning the basics on 1-3 champs spread out among 1-2 positions

> [{quoted}](name=Kelg,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rEwzML7e,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-12-14T21:08:46.598+0000)
>
> one tricking a champ only helps you get better at macro play so it won't suddenly make you challenger
> 
> It's kind of handicapping yourself at the end of the day, so I'd recommend getting good at a handful of champs instead of just one.

90% of this game is macro play. youll find people in d5 not playing mechanically much better than in gold or silver.

it depends strongly on the champion though. a silver azir player will probably suck ass at basic mechanics, while a diamond azir player is much better at the champion.

but you wont find a lot of mechanical skill differences between a silver jax main and a diamond jax main. the main difference is game knowledge.

knowledge of matchups, lane mechanics (minion control, wave manipulation optimal recall times, warding), decision making, map awareness etc.

> [{quoted}](name=Kelg,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rEwzML7e,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-12-14T21:08:46.598+0000)
>
> one tricking a champ only helps you get better at macro play so it won't suddenly make you challenger
> 
> It's kind of handicapping yourself at the end of the day, so I'd recommend getting good at a handful of champs instead of just one.

It is handicap it has bad and good sides. You get really good with that champ,learn matchups,mechanics,macro,you win most of the games but you also play other champions really bad. If you main Irelia and get autofill supp you will probably lose or if Irelia gets banned. So yea it is good to have 2-3 champs which I considered to do.

have a few "one tricks" under your belt.
Ideally have atleast one that is actually impactful.

I OTP
Leona-Jungle>Support.
Nocturne-Top>Jungle.
Trundle-Support(Retired, no longer viable)
Pantheon-Mid.

I like to OTP off meta things, I can maintain a 55% wr at Plat level with any of them, but the noticeable problem is that they are low-impact champions, and regardless of how well I do, I don't have much say in the outcome of matches. Like a Camille, Irelia, Jax, Lucian, Pyke, Akali, etc etc etc, would.

So...OTP what you want, but hopefully its something capable of carrying games :-P
